document.docAuthor: Elvebakk, A., Bjerke, J. W. & Støvern, L. E.
document.masterDocTitle: Parmelioid lichens (Parmeliaceae) in southernmost South America

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Parmelioid lichens (Parmeliaceae) in southernmost South America

mods:name.mods:affiliation: TromsØ University Museum, University of TromsØ - Arctic University of Norway, N- 9037 TromsØ, Norway. arve. elvebakk @ uit. no Norwegian Institute for Nature Research NINA, FRAM - High North Research Centre for Climate and the Environment, N- 9296 TromsØ, Norway. jarle. werner. bjerke @ nina. no

bibRefCitation.author: Hale Jr., M. E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Hale Jr., M. E. (1989) New species in the lichen genus Xanthoparmelia (Ascomycotina: Parmeliaceae). Mycotaxon 34: 541 - 564.

subSubSection.paragraph:
When
X. submougeotii
was described it was only reported from its type locality in the Juan Fernández Islands ( Chile ), whereas
Nash et al. (1995)
later added one collection from Mendoza in Argentina and two from the Falkland Islands . However, Calvelo & Adler (2001) reported it from many localities in Argentinian Tierra del Fuego, Etayo & Sancho (2008) added it from Chilean Isla Navarino and we have studied another 25 collections, indicating that this species is very common. All samples show the same chemistry with usnic, norstictic, stictic and constictic acids, and most specimens have characteristic subterminal soralia (Fig. 9).

Specimens examined:
